segments.source_content:
---
slug: /133
title: "This Week In React #133: Astro, React dying?, Qwikify, CRA, Next.js, Remix, Redux, Storybook, Redwood, Nextra, React-Native..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 01-31-2023
---

This year, I would like to make the newsletter a little more digestible. Do you have any suggestions for me? Do you think I put too many links and some can be deleted? Or do you like the exhaustive side? My goal is to make this newsletter less time consuming to write so that I can offer you more interesting content, like original articles. I'll explain it all to you soon.

Je vous expliquerai tout cela bientÃ´t.

Ou apprÃ©ciez-vous l'exhaustivitÃ© ? translations.fr: **[Astro - DÃ©bloquez de nouvelles possibilitÃ©s avec le rendu hybride](https://astro.build/blog/hybrid-rendering/)**
translations.en: **[Astro - DÃ©bloquez de nouvelles possibilitÃ©s avec le rendu hybride](https://astro.build/blog/hybrid-rendering/)**

segments.source_content: With Astro 1, you had to make a global choice for the whole site: 100% static (SSG) or 100% server (SSR). With Astro 2.0 it is now possible to choose for each page. The article details the internal workings of the Astro build, and how it had to evolve to support this new feature. They use static analysis to separate static routes from SSR routes.

translations.fr: Avec Astro 1, vous deviez choisir globalement pour tout le site : 100% statique (SSG) ou 100% serveur (SSR). Avec Astro 2.0, il est dÃ©sormais possible de choisir par page. L'article dÃ©taille le fonctionnement interne de la build Astro et ses adaptations pour cette nouvelle fonctionnalitÃ©. Ils utilisent une analyse statique pour sÃ©parer les routes statiques des routes SSR.
translations.en: Avec Astro 1, vous deviez choisir globalement pour tout le site : 100% statique (SSG) ou 100% serveur (SSR). Astro 2.0 permet dÃ©sormais de choisir par page. L'article dÃ©taille le fonctionnement interne de la build Astro et son Ã©volution pour supporter cette fonctionnalitÃ©. Ils utilisent une analyse statique pour sÃ©parer les routes statiques des routes SSR.

segments.source_content: Dominik explains why React is not about to die. React popularized JSX and the concept of component and declarative UI. The alternatives take the good parts and try to solve the problems, but it will be difficult to challenge it given the size of its ecosystem and its community that only gets stronger with time. It would take a big breakthrough innovation. Framework agnostic libraries (TanStack) have a role to play and allow to transfer knowledge from one ecosystem to another.

translations.fr: Dominik explique pourquoi React n'est pas prÃ¨s de disparaÃ®tre. React a popularisÃ© JSX et les concepts de composant et d'UI dÃ©clarative. Les alternatives reprennent ses bons aspects et tentent de rÃ©soudre ses problÃ¨mes, mais il sera difficile de le concurrencer vu la taille de son Ã©cosystÃ¨me et sa communautÃ© qui se renforce avec le temps. Il faudrait une innovation majeure. Les bibliothÃ¨ques agnostiques (TanStack) jouent un rÃ´le clÃ© en permettant de transfÃ©rer les connaissances entre Ã©cosystÃ¨mes.
translations.en: Dominik explique pourquoi React n'est pas moribond. React a popularisÃ© JSX et les concepts de composant et d'UI dÃ©clarative. Les alternatives reprennent les bonnes parties et tentent de rÃ©soudre les problÃ¨mes, mais il sera difficile de le dÃ©trÃ´ner vu la taille de son Ã©cosystÃ¨me et sa communautÃ© qui se renforce. Il faudrait une innovation majeure. Les bibliothÃ¨ques agnostiques (TanStack) jouent un rÃ´le en permettant de transfÃ©rer les connaissances entre Ã©cosystÃ¨mes.

segments.source_content: [![Resumable React: How To Use React Inside Qwik](/emails/issues/133/qwik.jpg)](https://www.builder.io/blog/resumable-react-how-to-use-react-inside-qwik)

translations.fr: [![Resumable React: How To Use React Inside Qwik](/emails/issues/133/qwik.jpg)](https://www.builder.io/blog/resumable-react-how-to-use-react-inside-qwik)
translations.en: [![Resumable React: How To Use React Inside Qwik](/emails/issues/133/qwik.jpg)](https://www.builder.io/blog/resumable-react-how-to-use-react-inside-qwik)

segments.source_content: **[Resumable React: How To Use React Inside Qwik](https://www.builder.io/blog/resumable-react-how-to-use-react-inside-qwik)**

This article highlights the integration between Qwik and React. Qwik is an innovative framework in beta, based on resumability rather than hydration. It exposes a method `qwikify$()` that allows to adapt an existing React component to be used in a Qwik app, with several possible hydration modes. To reduce the size of the bundle as much as possible, it is possible to avoid hydrating the React component and to use the native DOM events directly.

translations.fr: Cet article met en lumiÃ¨re l'intÃ©gration entre Qwik et React. Qwik est un framework innovant en version bÃªta, basÃ© sur la reprise plutÃ´t que sur l'hydratation. Il expose une mÃ©thode `qwikify$()` qui permet d'adapter un composant React existant pour Ãªtre utilisÃ© dans une application Qwik, avec plusieurs modes d'hydratation possibles. Pour rÃ©duire autant que possible la taille du bundle, il est possible d'Ã©viter d'hydrater le composant React et d'utiliser directement les Ã©vÃ©nements DOM natifs.
translations.en: Cet article met en lumiÃ¨re l'intÃ©gration entre Qwik et React. Qwik est un framework innovant en version bÃªta, basÃ© sur la reprise d'exÃ©cution (resumability) plutÃ´t que sur l'hydratation. Il expose une mÃ©thode `qwikify$()` qui permet d'adapter un composant React existant pour l'utiliser dans une application Qwik, avec plusieurs modes d'hydratation possibles. Pour rÃ©duire autant que possible la taille du bundle, il est possible d'Ã©viter d'hydrater le composant React et d'utiliser directement les Ã©vÃ©nements DOM natifs.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¬ [Replace Create React App recommendation with Vite - Dan Abramov answers](https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/pull/5487#issuecomment-1409720741): long comment from Dan. Tells the CRA story, goal, and future with 5 possible options. TLDR: they don't want to deprecate CRA but don't want to recommend it either: depriving yourself of SSG/SSR is not a good thing. It is possible that the CRA CLI will become a launcher that offers a choice between several popular frameworks: Next.js, Remix, CRA...
- ğŸ‘€ [AsyncContext + React](https://twitter.com/sebmarkbage/status/1620442034598477824): Sebastian MarkbÃ¥ge brings the idea of using TC39 stage 0 proposal [AsyncContext](https://github.com/legendecas/proposal-async-context) directly as React context ğŸ¤”
- ğŸ‘€ ["Statically typed links are coming to Next.js"](https://twitter.com/shuding_/status/1620137501192253440): great news for typesafe routing. Maybe this will be implemented with their new [TypeScript language server plugin](https://twitter.com/delba_oliveira/status/1592209522281439232), instead of a codegen step?
- ğŸ‘€ [Coming soon to Next.js - improved SEO support!](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1619743437577912321): new `metadata` export (will also be [typed with the new TS plugin?](https://twitter.com/shuding_/status/1619775431921762304))
- ğŸ“œ [The Key To Good Component Design Is Selfishness](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2023/01/key-good-component-design-selfishness/): the story a `<Button>` component design over time. It goes wrong because of using props to drive internal button content. It is worth limiting the responsibility of the button, using `children` and composition.
- ğŸ“œ [Storybook - Component Story Format 3 is here](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-csf3-is-here/): the new format comes out of beta and brings interesting improvements (boilerplate, composition, `play` function...) while remaining backward compatible.
- ğŸ“œ [How to create one form with many actions in Remix](https://www.wking.dev/library/how-to-create-one-form-with-many-actions-in-remix): use HTML buttons with `name` and `value` props, and use TypeScript union types with a schema for each action type.
- ğŸ“œ [Nextra 2 â€“ Next.js Static Site Generator](https://the-guild.dev/blog/nextra-2): presents the main new features of Nextra v2, the static-site-generator for Next.js.
- ğŸ“œ [How Netlify Uses Storybook for Visual Regression Testing](https://www.netlify.com/blog/storybook-visual-regression-testing/)
- ğŸ“œ [The Curious Case of React](https://cult.honeypot.io/reads/the-curious-case-of-react/)
- ğŸ¥ [Andrew Clark on the Creation of Redux](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WvRcZkuXmpo): this interview that relates the 2014-2015 period, good teaser of the [React documentary](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmp0istg5xo) that will be released soon. Redux offered the most elegant Flux implementation, and popularized the concept of reducer. Andrew doesn't disavow the project, but is happy that React is progressively proposing better alternatives for things like data fetching.
- ğŸ¥ [I Was Wrong About Nested React Components](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2sAdzy90GtE): Jack illustrates well why you shouldn't declare one component inside another.
- ğŸ¥ [Scroll Management with Remix and React Router](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4_H8j3rkpjI)
- ğŸ¥ [State of React Ecosystem Jan 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_nGuk2Gs2oc)
- ğŸ“¦ [Redwood 4.0](https://community.redwoodjs.com/t/redwood-v4-0-0-is-now-available/4538): official release of v4.0 with a new Auth API, GraphQL Yoga v3, GraphQL Armor...
- ğŸ“¦ [Remix 1.12](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.12.0): new dev server preview, behind a flag.
- ğŸ“¦ [React Router 6.8.0](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/releases/tag/react-router%406.8.0)

translations.fr: **[BibliothÃ¨ques JavaScript extensibles pour les enquÃªtes et formulaires](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)**
translations.en: **[BibliothÃ¨ques JavaScript extensibles pour les enquÃªtes et les formulaires](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)**

segments.source_content: [SurveyJS](https://github.com/surveyjs) is a set of open-source JavaScript form libraries that you can easily integrate into your web app. It lets you **create and run multiple forms**, retaining all sensitive data on your servers, or have **your own self-hosted WYSIWYG form builder** that non-tech users can use directly.

translations.fr: [SurveyJS](https://github.com/surveyjs) est un ensemble de bibliothÃ¨ques JavaScript open-source pour formulaires que vous pouvez facilement intÃ©grer Ã  votre application web. Il vous permet de **crÃ©er et exÃ©cuter plusieurs formulaires**, en conservant toutes les donnÃ©es sensibles sur vos serveurs, ou d'avoir **votre propre Ã©diteur de formulaires WYSIWYG auto-hÃ©bergÃ©** que les utilisateurs non techniques peuvent utiliser directement.
translations.en: [SurveyJS](https://github.com/surveyjs) est un ensemble de bibliothÃ¨ques JavaScript open-source pour formulaires que vous pouvez facilement intÃ©grer Ã  votre application web. Il vous permet de **crÃ©er et exÃ©cuter plusieurs formulaires**, en conservant toutes les donnÃ©es sensibles sur vos serveurs, ou d'avoir **votre propre constructeur de formulaires WYSIWYG auto-hÃ©bergÃ©** que les utilisateurs non techniques peuvent utiliser directement.

segments.source_content: You can also **analyze survey results** in custom-built dashboards, save your forms to PDF, or simply **convert them to editable PDF files**. It offers native support for **React and Angular rendering** and total freedom of choice as to the backend, because **any server + database combination is fully compatible**.

translations.fr: Vous pouvez Ã©galement **analyser les rÃ©sultats des enquÃªtes** dans des tableaux de bord personnalisÃ©s, enregistrer vos formulaires au format PDF ou simplement **les convertir en fichiers PDF modifiables**. Il offre une prise en charge native pour le **rendu React et Angular** et une totale libertÃ© de choix pour le backend, car **toute combinaison serveur + base de donnÃ©es est entiÃ¨rement compatible**.
translations.en: Vous pouvez Ã©galement **analyser les rÃ©sultats des enquÃªtes** dans des tableaux de bord personnalisÃ©s, sauvegarder vos formulaires au format PDF, ou simplement **les convertir en fichiers PDF modifiables**. Il offre une prise en charge native pour le **rendu React et Angular** et une libertÃ© totale de choix concernant le backend, car **toute combinaison serveur + base de donnÃ©es est entiÃ¨rement compatible**.

segments.source_content: The TLDR newsletter is hiring its first engineer to help build out the hiring platform along with other internal projects. Looking for someone with experience shipping side projects or on small teams, with experience in Next.js and Postgres/Supabase.

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

segments.source_content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.

segments.source_content:
- [TC39 January 2023 meeting](https://github.com/babel/proposals/issues/86): great proposals like [Immutable Array methods (change array by copy)](https://twitter.com/AndaristRake/status/1620154153250217988) or [Symbols as WeakMap keys](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1620385689853661185) are progressing to stage 4.
- [TypeScript 5.0 Beta](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-5-0-beta/): this [video by Matt Pocock](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iOTAFRFgm8I) highlights some of the most interesting features such as decorators and const type parameters.
- [Release Notes for Safari Technology Preview 162](https://webkit.org/blog/13703/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-162/): CSS nesting, declarative shadow DOM...
- [Scrollend, a new JavaScript event](https://developer.chrome.com/blog/scrollend-a-new-javascript-event/): already in Chrome, Firefox and polyfills available.
- ["Turbopack is adding support for webpack loaders"](https://twitter.com/jaredpalmer/status/1619071988181651456)
- [Whatâ€™s next for Flutter](https://medium.com/flutter/whats-next-for-flutter-b94ce089f49c)
- [Youâ€™ve Got Options for Removing Event Listeners](https://www.macarthur.me/posts/options-for-removing-event-listeners)
- [Deno 1.30: Built-in Node modules](https://deno.com/blog/v1.30)
- [10 Web Development Trends in 2023](https://www.robinwieruch.de/web-development-trends/)
- [2023 State of Databases for Serverless & Edge](https://leerob.io/blog/backend)
- [Improve your test experience with Playwright Soft Assertions](https://timdeschryver.dev/blog/improve-your-test-experience-with-playwright-soft-assertions)
